alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Martin; Lower St. Mary; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Mary (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 8:32PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN IBERIA...NORTH CENTRAL ST. MARY AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. MARTIN PARISHES THROUGH 900 PM CST... At 832 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Baldwin, or over Franklin, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Baldwin, Charenton, Pierre Part, and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for south central Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Lower St. Martin; Lower St. Mary; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Mary
